definitions.title: Qal
definitions.body: Pt. pass [[עֲלֻמֵנוּ]] Ps 90:8 as subst. our secret, i.e. hidden sin (‖[[עֲוֹנׁת]]).

definitions.title: Niph.
definitions.body: Pf. be concealed, of wisdom, 3 fs. [[נֶעֶלְמָה מֵעֵינֵי]] Job 28:21; of a fact or condition, [[נֶעְלַם]] 2Ch 9:2, ´[[וְנ]] consec. Le 5:2, Le 5:3, Le 5:4 (all c. [[מִן]] pers.), [[מֵעֵינֵי]] ´[[וְנ]] Le 4:13, Nu 5:13 (all P); Pt.
[[נֶעְלָם]] concealed, c. [[הָיׇה]] in periphrastic conjug. 1Ki 10:3 ([[מִן]] pers.); abs. [[כָּל־נֶעְלָם]] Ec 12:14.
fs. [[תְּהִי נַעֲלָמָה]] Na 3:11 mayest thou become obscured (as to the senses; fig. for swoon), but very doubtful, read perhaps [[נעלפה]] ? [Dr].
pl. [[נַעֲלָמִים]] Ps 26:4 those who conceal themselves, i.e. their thoughts; dissemblers (‖[[מְתֵי שָׁוְא]]).

definitions.title: Hiph.
definitions.body: Pf. 3 ms. [[הֶעְלִים]] 2Ki 4:27; 3 pl. [[הֶעְלִימוּ]] Ez Eze 22:26; Impf. 2 ms. [[תַּעְלִים]] Ps 10:1, [[תַּעְלֵם]] La 3:56; 3 mpl. [[יַעְלִימוּ]] Le 20:4, etc.; Inf. abs. [[הַעְלֵם]] v:Le 20:4; Pt. [[מַעְלִים]] Job 42:3, Pr 28:27; —conceal, hide, c. [[מִן]] pers. 2Ki 4:27 (‖[[לאׁ הִגִּיד לִי]]); usu. hide the eyes from ([[מִן]]), i.e. disregard Is 1:15, Ez Eze 22:26, ´[[וגו]] ´[[הַעְלֵם יַע]] Le 20:4, [[מִן]] om. Pr 28:27; hide the eyes by ([[ב]]) a bribe 1Sa 12:3 (i.e. pervert justice, but v. I. [[עַיִן]]

definitions.title: 3 d
definitions.body: ); hide (cover) the ear La 3:56 (turn a deaf ear); hide (obscure) counsel ([[עֵחָה]]) Job 42:3; [[לָמָה]] ´[[תַּע]] Ps 10:1 why dost thou [´[[י]]] hide, sc. thine eyes (so most), or practise concealment (= hide thyself)?

definitions.title: Hithp.
definitions.body: Pf. 2 ms. consec. [[וְהִתְעַלַּמְתָּ מֵהֶם]] De 22:1, De 22:4 and thou hide thyself completely from them (utterly neglect to aid), so Inf. cstr. ([[מֵהֶם]] om.) [[לְהִתְעַלֵּם]] v:De 22:3; so also Impf. c. [[מִן]], [[תִּתְעַלַּם]] Ps 55:2, [[תִּתְעַלָָּם]] Is 58:7; once lit. [[יִתְעַלֶּם־שָָׁלֶג]] Job 6:16 wherein snow hides itself.
